intro: Hypogomphia, commonly known as the false buttonweed, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its small, yellowish to brownish flowers arranged in a compact cluster, often resembling a button. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is native to regions of southern Africa. Hypogomphia species are herbaceous perennials that can form dense mats, often found in disturbed or arid environments. Their botanical structure includes narrow, linear leaves and a fibrous root system adapted to low-water conditions.
